content.question: The position of a particle moving in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane is given by <math alttext="open parenthesis, x of t, comma, y of t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="x of t, equals, t cubed, plus 2 t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, 5 times t squared, minus 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the speed of the particle at time <math alttext="t equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
